The dynamic routing ISL routes are dynamically changed based on the Fibre Channel exchange ID, which is unique for each I/O operation. ISL is assigned at I/O request time; therefore, different I/Os from same incoming port to same destination port are assigned different ISLs. With FIDR, IBM z16 servers feature the following advantages for performance and management in configurations with ISL and cascaded FICON directors:  Support sharing of ISLs between FICON and FCP (PPRC or distributed)  I/O traffic is better balanced between all available ISLs  Improved use of FICON director and ISL  Easier to manage with a predicable and repeatable I/O performance FICON dynamic routing can be enabled by defining dynamic routing-capable switches and control units in HCD.
